meanings.definition: To move quickly or with great haste.
meanings.sent1: She rushed to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The students rushed out of the classroom when the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rushed to gather nuts before winter came.
meanings.sent4: Time rushed by like a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The river rushed over the rocks, bubbling with energy.

meanings.definition: Done quickly or without careful consideration.
meanings.sent1: He made a rushed decision without thinking it through.
meanings.sent2: The rushed painting lacked attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The rushed cake looked messy but tasted delicious.
meanings.sent4: The rushed project ended up full of mistakes.
meanings.sent5: Her rushed speech left out important information.

meanings.sent1: She felt rushed trying to finish all her tasks before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The rushed employee was always on edge.
meanings.sent3: The rushed cat knocked things over in its haste.
meanings.sent4: His rushed heartbeat signaled his anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The rushed atmosphere in the room made everyone tense.
